main event: A civilian observed a single bright light object with erratic movements near Dayton, Ohio on June 4, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared like a bright star with erratic movements, including disappearing and reappearing at random.
The object was observed for around 4 minutes.
The object was seen in the western sky at an elevation of 20-25 degrees.
The Air Force concluded the object was likely the planet Venus or Jupiter, as they were not visible in the sky at that time.
The motion of the object was described as similar to a star.
